lom:description.lom:string:
Conference website has the agenda with links to download each of the talks. "This is the fifth in a series of biannual conferences honoring David Blackwell and Richard Tapia, two seminal figures who inspired a generation of African-American, Native American and Latino/Latina students to pursue careers in mathematics. Carrying forward their work, this one and a half day conference will
* recognize and showcase mathematical excellence by minority researchers * recognize and disseminate successful efforts to address under-representation * inform students and mathematicians about career opportunities in mathematics, especially outside academia * provide networking opportunities for mathematical researchers at all points in the higher education/career trajectory."

lom:keyword.lom:string: African American, Hispanic, role models, Latino, Latina, Chicano, Chicana, Native American
